comment: I which we could hear the students...
lecture 2 was such an effective filter :P

Also one must be careful that the so called ultrasensitivity which only implies the shape of the response not the actual speed / slope. In the decoy model, the ultrasensitivity actually has a slower response than without the decoy.
Both degradation and negative feedback just reduce response time by making the response weaker. The real cost there is very similar.
Guillermo R  Biology Systems reference to Lecture1 Lecture 2 Lecture16...
